messages.original:
You know the information space is bad when someone calls me "biased" or "unreliable" and I have to check their profile to see if they're calling me too Pro-Russian or too Pro-Ukrainian 
ü§£
ü§£
A car bombing in Moscow has killed Major General Fanil Sarvarov, the head of the operational training department of the Russian General Staff.
Large fires are burning in Russia‚Äôs Taman Bay on the Black Sea following an overnight Ukrainian drone attack. 2 vessels were struck, and damage to a pier has been reported
Large fires are burning in Russia‚Äôs Taman Bay on the Black Sea following an overnight Ukrainian drone attack. 2 vessels were struck, and damage to a pier has been reported

Ukrzaliznytsia reports that a freight train derailed near the city of Korosten, Zhytomyr Oblast.
They stated that the cause is "unknown", however it is known that it was struck by multiple Russian Geran-2 drones overnight.
2 Russian Su-34s are flying to their launch lines in the Black Sea to launch glide-bombs at Odesa Oblast.
2 Russian Su-34s are flying to their launch lines in the Black Sea to launch glide-bombs at Odesa Oblast.

Currently over Crimea, flying west. 
Gerans are also over the western Black Sea, flying to Odesa Oblast
Currently over Crimea, flying west.   Gerans are also over the western Black Sea, flying to Odesa Oblast
Both Su-34s are now over the Black Sea. 2 Su-35s are covering them.
A Russian recon drone is operating just off the coast from Zatoka, Odesa Oblast. The glide-bombs will likely fly there.
Su-34s are around 100 km from their launch lines
Su-34s are around 100 km from their launch lines
Approaching their launch lines
Approaching their launch lines
Launch maneuvers
Launch maneuvers
KABs are flying towards Zatoka, Odesa Oblast.
KABs are flying towards Zatoka, Odesa Oblast.
2 KABs in total, both flying towards Zatoka Bridge.
These are Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs. They changed their course towards Chornomorsk, Odesa Oblast.

Explosions near Chornomorsk.
Repeated launches were carried out.
Explosions near Chornomorsk.  Repeated launches were carried out.

The repeated launches were carried out at a very high altitude. 
The glide-bombs will likely fly to the Mayaky Bridge.
The repeated launches were carried out at a very high altitude.   The glide-bombs will likely fly to the Mayaky Bridge.

These ones seem to be flying at a similar speed to ordinary KABs. 
Approaching the coast, around 35 km from the Mayaky Bridge.
These ones seem to be flying at a similar speed to ordinary KABs.   Approaching the coast, around 35 km from the Mayaky Bridge.

Explosion near Karolino-Buhaz, Odesa Oblast. Somewhere near the coast. 1 more KAB is approaching.
Both Su-34s are flying east over Crimea back to their base airfield.
Explosion near Karolino-Buhaz, Odesa Oblast. Somewhere near the coast. 1 more KAB is approaching.  Both Su-34s are flying east over Crimea back to their base airfield.
Another explosion. All clear now.
Military Situation In Ukraine On December 21, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On December 21, 2025 (Maps Update)

Foreign Fighters Face "Meat Grinder": The Future Fate of International Legion in Ukraine
Reforms in the Ukrainian army are not good news for foreign mercenaries. There will be almost no room left for them in the comfortable rear. The soldiers of fortune are extremely skeptical of the new commander, as evidenced by their unwillingness to serve under him.
Since the pace of mobilization cannot meet the Ukrainian army‚Äôs current needs, command is beginning to take radical steps. Specifically, they are drawing on all available resources from the rear and sending them to the assault troops. Foreign mercenaries who came to earn easy money have now fallen victim to this fate.
There are four foreign legions operating within the Ukrainian army. Three are combat units and one is a training unit that replenishes frontline units after a short training period. The term "legion" is used exclusively for propaganda purposes to create the impression that the unit is larger than it actually is. 
üëâ

How Fog Became An Ally For The Russian Army In The Sumy Sector: The Capture Of Hrabovske In Ukraine 
Russian forces are intensifying pressure across the entire front: in the Sumy sector, assault troops, exploiting thick fog, have captured Hrabovske and are pushing toward Riasne; in the Pokrovsk sector, they are clearing Myrnohrad; while in the Kharkiv and Zaporizhzhia sectors, they are methodically driving back Ukrainian units, seizing strongpoints and tree lines. 
This tactical pressure is mirrored by deep cracks in the EU's united front: due to resistance from a number of countries, the bloc is forced to finance Kyiv through a complex loan scheme, effectively acknowledging the impossibility of directly using frozen Russian assets.
üëâ

Israel Fakes Panic Over Iranian Missiles To Push U.S. Towards Another War With Islamic Republic
In an unsurprising development, Israel is planning a new war on Iran, and actively working on securing support from the United States for this by using the Islamic Republic‚Äôs missile program as a pretext.
This was first revealed by NBC News which reported on December 20 that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will present plans for a possible fresh attack on Iran to President Donald Trump during his upcoming visit to the U.S. The meeting is expected to take place in the Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida at the end of the month.
According to the report, Israel is growing increasingly concerned that Iran is rebuilding and even expanding its ballistic missile production in the wake of the nations‚Äô 12-day war in June.
üëâ

Ukrainian Involvement Suspected In Assassination Of Russian Officer In Moscow (Video)
The head of the Operational Training Directorate at the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces, Lt. Gen. Fanil Sarvarov, was killed in an explosion in southern Moscow on December 22, with investigators suspecting the involvement of Ukrainian security agencies.
Russian Investigative Committee Spokeswoman Svetlana Petrenko confirmed the death of Lt. Gen. Sarvarov just a few hours after the explosion took place in the early morning.
‚ÄúAccording to an investigation, on the morning of December 22, an explosive device planted under a car was activated on Yasenevaya Street in Moscow. Fanil Sarvarov, head of the General Staff‚Äôs Operational Training Directorate, has died of injuries from the explosion,‚Äù Petrenko told TASS.
Moscow‚Äôs Main Investigative Directorate has opened a criminal case and that investigators are pursuing several theories, according to Petrenko.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

With Defeat Nearing In Myrnohrad, Ukraine Loses First Australian Abrams Close To Pokrovsk (Videos)
Ukraine lost the first of over 40 American-made M1A1 Abrams main battle tanks it recently received from Australia close to the city of Pokrovsk, as it inches closer towards a catastrophic defeat in the nearby city of Myrnohrad in the Donetsk direction.
The tank was destroyed by the Center for Advanced Unmanned Technologies ‚ÄúRubicon,‚Äù which said in a post to Telegram that it received support from the 76th Guards Air Assault Division of the Russian military‚Äôs Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces.
Footage released by Rubicon shows the tank abandoned and on fire after being targeted with multiple first-person view suicide drones.
The loss took place on December 20, just a day after Australia announced that it had delivered all 49 M1A1 Abrams tanks it committed to provide to Ukraine.
üëâ

HERE

Military Situation In Syria On December 22, 2025 (Map Update)

Seizure Of Dozens Of Anti-Aircraft Missiles Sounds Alarm On Security Situation In Syria (Photos)
The Syrian Ministry of Interior announced on December 22 that its forces seized dozens of man-portable air-defense systems (MANPADs) in the eastern governorate of Deir Ezzor, highlighting the fragile security situation in the war-torn country.
‚ÄúAccurate information was received by the security directorate in al-Bukamal indicating that anti-aircraft missiles were being hidden inside a house, in preparation for smuggling them out of the country,‚Äù the ministry said in a statement.
‚ÄúBased on this information, a well-planned raid was carried out, resulting in the seizure of SAM-7 missiles,‚Äù it added.
The SAM-7 is a common name in the Middle East for the Soviet-made 9K32 Strela-2, also known by NATO reporting name SA-7 Grail. Photos shared by the ministry show more than 24 missiles, along with a number of gripstocks and thermal batteries.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE
